nodes.summary: House Republican Thomas Massie joined Democrats and three other Republicans in signing a discharge petition to release Jeffrey Epstein files.

nodes.name: House Republicans
nodes.summary: Four House Republicans (Greene, Mace, Boebert, Massie) joined Democrats in signing a discharge petition to release Epstein files; Trump attacked Greene.

nodes.name: CBS News
nodes.summary: CBS News is BBC's US partner. Trump disputed CBS over a 60 Minutes interview with Kamala Harris. Greene told CBS News she stands with Epstein victims.

nodes.name: MAGA
nodes.summary: MAGA is Trump's political movement. Marjorie Taylor Greene is a longtime MAGA ally who recently criticized Trump's foreign policy and handling of Epstein files, prompting Trump to withdraw support and

nodes.name: America First
nodes.summary: Trump's political slogan. Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene questioned if Trump still prioritized it, prompting Trump to withdraw support for her.

nodes.name: foreign policy
nodes.summary: Trump's foreign policy focus criticized by Marjorie Taylor Greene, who questions his involvement in foreign conflicts and tariff policies amid their political dispute.

nodes.name: Epstein petition
nodes.summary: Discharge petition calling for release of Epstein files, signed by Greene, Mace, Boebert, Massie and Democrats. Trump opposes it, pressuring Republicans ahead of next week's vote.

nodes.name: midterm election
nodes.summary: Trump called for Marjorie Taylor Greene to be unseated in next year's midterm election by a Republican challenger.

nodes.name: tariff policies
nodes.summary: Trump's tariff policies criticized by Marjorie Taylor Greene; US-Swiss trade deal includes tariff reduction.

nodes.name: foreign conflicts
nodes.summary: Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene criticized President Trump's involvement in foreign conflicts and focus on foreign policy, leading to Trump withdrawing his support.

Gulf Air
nodes.summary: Jeffrey Epstein suggested a Gulf Air flight to Steve Bannon in November 2018 emails, mentioning a 950 departure with a Bahrain stop.

nodes.name: Bahrain
nodes.summary: Bahrain was suggested as a stopover on a Gulf Air flight by Jeffrey Epstein to Steve Bannon in November 2018.

nodes.name: News: The Aussie giving War & Peace a 'b
War & Peace
nodes.summary: Ander Louis created a 'bogan' (Australian slang) remake of Tolstoy's War & Peace, translating Russian high society into Aussie lingo. Started as 2018 joke, now near book deal.

nodes.name: Leo Tolstoy
nodes.summary: Leo Tolstoy wrote War & Peace, a 1,200+ page epic Russian novel set in early 19th-century high society during Napoleonic wars, considered 'the Everest of literature'.

nodes.name: Ander Louis
nodes.summary: Ander Louis is the pen name of Melbourne IT worker Andrew Tesoriero, 39, who created a 'bogan' Australian slang version of War & Peace starting in 2018, now nearing a book deal.

nodes.name: Andrew Tesoriero
nodes.summary: Andrew Tesoriero, 39, Melbourne IT worker, wrote 'bogan' Australian slang War & Peace as Ander Louis since 2018, nearing book deal.

nodes.name: Lana Lam
nodes.summary: Lana Lam wrote a BBC article on Nov 14, 2025, about Ander Louis's 'bogan' Australian translation of War & Peace.

nodes.name: Sydney
nodes.summary: BBC article about 'bogan' War & Peace remake filed from Sydney on Nov 14, 2025.

nodes.name: Prince Andrei
nodes.summary: Prince Andrei appears in new Australian 'bogan' translation of War & Peace, described as arriving at Anna's joint as her husband.

nodes.name: Anna
nodes.summary: Anna appears in Ander Louis's 'bogan' Australian slang translation of War & Peace as a pregnant character married to Prince Andrei.

nodes.name: Melbourne
nodes.summary: Melbourne IT worker Andrew Tesoriero (pen name Ander Louis) created a 'bogan' Australian slang translation of War & Peace starting in 2018.

nodes.name: Kath & Kim
nodes.summary: Popular Australian sitcom Kath & Kim exemplifies 'bogan' slang and culture, serving as a reference point for Aussie vernacular.

nodes.name: Napoleonic wars
nodes.summary: Tolstoy's War & Peace is set in Russian high society during the Napoleonic wars of early 1800s. The epic novel has 15 books, 361 chapters, and over 1,200 pages.

nodes.name: Lilydale
nodes.summary: Lilydale is a suburb on the outskirts of Melbourne, Australia, where author Ander Louis was interviewed about his 'bogan' translation of War & Peace.

nodes.name: Bogan
nodes.summary: Australian slang from the 1980s, originally meaning 'unsophisticated and uncultured person' but now often used as a term of endearment for flippant, irreverent Australian lingo.
